name: Personal Website
desc: The personal portfolio website you are currently reading! I built this in order to teach myself frontend software and design skills to better support my project team in Project Emory.

name: RIDEmory
desc: A full-stack, comprehensive, self-updating rideshare solution for Emory students accessible either via the web or through GroupMe. Currently a work in progress - this project is used to teach Project Emory members parts of the tech stack that are taught in the Project Emory curriculum.

name: Canyon
desc: A full-stack messaging app used to facilitate casual, in-person debates among new friends to allow for better connections. This was my CS Practicum class's project.

name: Resume Revamper
desc: A web-based resume editor powered by Claude used to minimize low-level text decisions such as word choice and phrasing and focus on big-picture content goals. Automatically parses PDF resumes and outputs a PDF resume when editing is done. This was my Natural Language Processing course's final project.

name: Efficient Speech Emotion Classification
desc: A Python toolkit used to transform and augment audio into Mel Spectrograms and allow for easy processing in pre-trained convolutional neural networks. Applied transfer learning from the ImageNet dataset and achieved 78.6% accuracy over 6 emotions. This was my Machine Learning course's final project.

name: .dotfiles
desc: A collection of all my custom dotfiles, including a script to automatically install all dependencies, styles, and configurations in a single command.

name: Memly
desc: A 48-hour minimum viable product built for HackATL. Proof of concept for a general purpose spaced-repetition progress tracker app.

name: BibleBot
desc: Scripture from your Discord client to your heart. An integrated quick-reference Discord bot used by 5m+ users across 60,000+ Discord servers.

name: Voice Calculator
desc: A hands-free 15-function calculator written using Sphinx4 and MaryTTS. Comes with custom configuration settings and built-in grammar regex in order to increase speech detection accuracy.
